    Research Students

    You may find below the list of my PhD Thesis Students , Master Thesis Students and Project Students along with very brief description of their works:

    PhD Thesis Students

    9. Mr. Ritish Kumar

    Title: Multi-wavelength spectral energy distribution study of Active Galactic Nuclie
    Duration: 2020- present
    Affiliation: Central University of Himachal Pradesh
    At Present: CUHP; Webpage:

    In brief the main problem addressed in this thesis is … More detail here

    8. Mr. Vivek Kumar Jha

    Title: Investigating the Nature and Structure of the Broad Line Region in Active Galactic Nuclei
    Duration: 2016- present
    Affiliation: Aryabhatta Research Institute of Observation Sciences
    At Present: ARIES; Webpage:

    Abstract: Even with large telescope apertures and vast improvements in detector technology, resolving the inner regions of active galaxies remains a formidable challenge. Nevertheless, understanding the innermost regions of these galaxies is critical to understanding the galaxy evolution and the structure and dynamics of matter in the vicinity of a Supermassive Black Hole (SMBH). In this thesis, we have explored indirect methods to further our understanding of the innermost regions in Active galactic nuclei (AGN). More detail here

    Project Students

    1. (25.) INOV properties of blazar like BALQSOs; Ms Sridevi, IISER-Bhopal 2017 (cont).

    2. (24.) INOV properties of X-ray detected and gamma-ray undetected NLSY-1 galaxies ; Mr. Parth Sunil, IISER-Bhopal 2017.

    3. (23.) Photometric Reverberation mapping of low-luminosity AGN ; Mr. Krishan Kumar, ARIES, ARIES-gradual school project 2017(ongoing).

    4. Measuring the time delay in multiple lens QSOs, ; Ms. Kanchan Soni, IISER TVM, INSPIRE fellow, June-July 2016.

    5. Constraining mean UV-radiation field (J21) using transverse proximity effects in QSO pairs ; Ms. Priyanka Jalan, ARIES Graduate school project, May-July 2016.

    6. Modeling the occurrence rate of MgII absorber using halo mass function ; Mr. Anurag Mishra, IIST-TVM, June-July 2016.

    7. Probing the physical state of 21cm absorber in the line of sight to background radio quasar; Ms. Avani Parmar, Pune Universityr, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2015.

    8. Probing cool gas outflow base on number density of MgII absorbers; ARIES Graduate school project, Ms. Sapna Mishra, May-July 2015

    9. Faraday rotaton of intervening galaxy, a probe of high-z magnetic filed; Ms. Vidushi Sharma, ARIES Graduate school project, May-July 2015.

    10. Probing the associated environment of the quasar q0059-2735; Pritam Jayoti, Tejpur central University, Assam, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2014.

    11. Blazar absorber spectroscopy from UVES/VLT and HCT data; Sruthil, Paundichery central University, Paundichery, Academy summer fellow, May-June 2014.

    12. Astrophysical Line Driven Winds; Reetika Joshi, Kumaun University Nainital, INSPIRE fellow, April-June 2014.

    13. Incidence of Mg II absorption systems towards Steep-spectrum radio quasars and blazars; Anikhet Gaur, IISER Mohali, INSPIRE fellow Dec. 2013 (coming for project extension)

    14. Incidence of CIV absorption systems towards flat-spectrum radio quasars and blazars, Mayank Singh, CBS Mumbai, Academy summer fellow, Dec 2013 (coming for project extension)

    15. The Broad absorption line (BAL) QSOs: constraint outflow using BAL line, Pritam Jayoti, Tejpur central University, Assam, Academy summer fellow, May-June 2013.

    16. The X-ray loud BAL QSOs: spectral variability modeling, , Jhilik Majumday, Jadhapur University, West Bangal, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2013.

    17. Optical micro-variability study of Quasars, Hemant Kumar Verma, PRS University Raipur, March-April 2013.

    18. Spectral properties of flat-spectrum radio quasars, Sukruti Bansal, IISER Pune, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2012 (project report prepared and talk given)

    19. Incidence of CIV absorption systems towards flat-spectrum radio quasars and blazars, Mayank Singh, CBS Mumbai, Academy summer fellow, May-June 2012 (project report prepared and talk given)

    20. On the Incidence Rate of Intervening CIV Absorption Systems Towards SSRQs and RQQSO ; Deepak Kumar Deo, IISER Bhopal, INSPIRE fellow, May-June 2012 (project report prepared and talk given)

    21. Incidence of Mg II absorption systems towards Steep-spectrum radio quasars and blazars; Anikhet Gaur, IISER Mohali, INSPIRE fellow June-July 2012 (project report prepared and talk given)

    22. Does number statistics of MgII absorption line systems depend on polarisation of background sources?; Parashakti, Bharathidasan Uni., Tiruchirapalli, Academy summer fellow, May-June 2011 (project report prepared and talk given)

    23. Probing the cosmological variation of the fine-structure constant; Ramabhadran Sundaram, NITK Surathkal, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2010 (project report prepared and talk given)

    24. Photo- ionization modeling of QSO absorber: zabs = 1.149 seen toward QSO HE0515-4414; NIT Roukela, Academy summer fellow, June-July 2010 (project report prepared and talk given)

    25. Wavelet analysis of AGN light curve; Tushar Aggrawal, NIT Jamshedpur, June-July 2010
